snippet: In the five months since a drought emergency was declared, Californians have barely cut their water consumption, leading some residents to get personal about waste.
abstract: Californians have cut their water consumption only 5 percent in five months compared with recent years since a drought emergency was declared; cities, faced with apparent indifference to stern warnings from state leaders and media alarms, have encouraged residents to tattle on their neighbors for wasting water--and residents have responded in droves.

byline.contributor: Robert B. Gunnison contributed reporting from Sacramento.

lead_paragraph: In the five months since a drought emergency was declared, Californians have barely cut their water consumption, leading some residents to get personal about waste.

headline.main: Californians Keep Up With Joneses’ Water Use
headline.print_headline: Californians Keep Up With Joneses’ Water Use
